column9: Turnaround play confirmed by a massive 66% EPS beat ($0.10 vs $0.06 est) reported today. Despite the profitability surge and reaffirmed outlook, the stock is virtually flat (+0.07%), suggesting the market has not yet priced in the operational improvements and cost savings.

Semiconductor equipment supplier signaling the 'trough is over' with a Q4 beat and Q1 guidance significantly above consensus ($250M revenue midpoint vs $239M est). The stock rose ~6% post-market, staying within the 8% buy limit, validating the trend without overextending.

Consistent compounder delivered another double beat (EPS $0.54 vs $0.49) today with minimal price reaction (+1.9%). High-quality medical device play (MRI pumps) trading at a discount to its growth consistency.

Classic PEAD play following a 'Beat and Raise' Q4 report. The company raised FY2026 guidance significantly above consensus, driven by accelerating demand for its AI-powered 'Verity' finance automation platform, yet the after-hours reaction (+3%) appears muted relative to the fundamental improvement.

Classic PEAD setup: Calix reported a Q4 earnings beat ($0.39 EPS vs estimates) and strong AI platform demand on Feb 12, yet the stock is flat/down (-0.18%), creating a divergence between fundamentals and price action.
Double Catalyst: Company gained 'Preferred Vendor' status with a major cloud provider (Feb 11) and saw significant insider buying (72k shares) on Feb 10 while trading at 52-week lows.
Irrational selloff following Q4 earnings has created a deep value opportunity, especially given the massive FY26 guidance beat ($2.75 EPS vs $2.22 est) which implies significant undervaluation.
Market is focusing on a backward-looking Q4 earnings miss while ignoring a massive FY26 guidance raise where management doubled EPS expectations ($0.88-$0.92 vs $0.43 est).
High-conviction insider buying from the COO ($2.75M purchase) signals confidence in dividend sustainability and NAV stability despite broader BDC sector headwinds.
